problem_text:
a) Is there an infinite finitely generated residually finite p-group, in which the order |g| of an arbitrary element g does not exceed f(δ(g)), where δ(g) is the length of g with respect to a fixed set of generators and f(n) is a function growing at n → ∞ slower than any power function n^λ, λ > 0?
R. I. Grigorchuk
answer: Yes, there is (A. V. Rozhkov, Dokl. Math., 58, no. 2 (1998), 234–237).
